sols_html:
A Carmichael number is a composite number n which satisfies

\(\displaystyle b^{n-1} \equiv 1 \mod{n}\)

for all integers with \(\displaystyle \gcd(b,n) = 1\).

For 561, we use Korselt’s criterion which states that for each prime dividing n, we must check that \(\displaystyle (p-1)\mid(n-1)\). Since

\(\displaystyle 561 = 3 \cdot 11 \cdot 17\)

we check that

\[\begin{aligned} (3-1) &= 2 \mid 560 \\ (11-1) &= 10 \mid 560 \\ (17-1) &= 16 \mid 560\end{aligned}\]

valid since \(\displaystyle 560 = 2^{4} \cdot 5 \cdot 7\). Thus 561 is a Carmichael number.
